newsitem.title: UK: UK wool sale sees high clearance.
newsitem.headline: UK wool sale sees high clearance.

text.p: The Committee of London Wool Brokers offered on behalf of the British Wool Marketing Board some 2,320,000 kilos of British Wool at the first Scottish sale of the season held in Bradford on August 13.

Good competition produced a high clearance of bred and cross wools. Blackface had not been offered since the end of the last season on May 14 but sold well at lower prices. Total clearance was nearly 90 percent.

Compared with the July 13 Bradford sale Halfbred hogs were five percent dearer with other Halfbreds fully firm. Crosses were up to 2.5 percent dearer. Compared with the May 14 Scottish sale Cheviots were fully 2.5 percent dearer. Blackface was 5-10 percent cheaper apart from Light Grey which was 2.5 percent dearer.
